item.title: Report E-2023060538
item.description:
Report E-2023060538

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-17
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Environmental Works was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an 8ft-by-10ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that two (2) gallons of material was released due to a nail damaging the bottom of one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. Environmental Works personnel removed all the cargo from the trailer and transferred the non-damaged drums to a new pallet due to heavy impact to the original pallet by the released material. The impacted pallet was cut up and placed into two (2) 55- gallon poly drums. Environmental Works personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area of the trailer floor and neutralized the trailer floor. Environmental Works personnel confirmed the area was neutralized with a pH strip. The spent absorbents and neutralizers were gathered and containerized into the two (2) 55-gallon poly drums along with the cut-up pallet. The damaged 55-gallon poly drum was overpacked into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023060421
item.description:
Report E-2023060421

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDM experienced a UN3082 "Enlist Duo" release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-cups of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the top of the poly tote due to a defective cap. Contractors transferred the product from the damaged tote into a new one. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with absorbent pads into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023060418
item.description:
Report E-2023060418

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-01
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 1, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon jug of potassium hydroxide (UN3266) was damaged in transit and released approximately one (1) ounce of product to a cardboard box. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel utilized absorbent pads to collect all free standing product, then wiped down the undamaged cargo for continued shipping. The crew then overpacked the damaged jug, impacted box, and all other UN3266 impacted material in one (1) 35-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: XPO Terminal XDM contacted ERTS to report (8) 5-gallon plastic pails containing UN1814 Potassium Hydroxide 45% were discovered leaking due to improper loading, releasing an unknown amount of the product to the dock floor. ERTS dispatched a contractor for clean up. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-quart of product released from (2) 5-gallon plastic jugs to a 2’ x 2' area of the concrete dock floor. The jugs caps were cracked due to them falling over after the pallet collapsed. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All material was collected and containerized into (2) 55-gallon plastic drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: At 0956 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XSC. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of UN3266 Cir Kleen No. 265 was released from a 55-gallon plastic drum. The release impacted the inside of trailer #3112327. ERTS dispatched a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of product released to a 4' x 4' area of the trailer floor due to a damaged/fault cap. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged drum and cleanup debris was collected into a 95-gallon poly over pack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report I-2023030085

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-01
  • City: WEVER
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MARTIN TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The root cause of the incident (release) was due to the drivers failure to check for the presence of a properly secured washout cap during an equipment pre-trip inspection at a tank wash facility. Additionally, at the loading facility, as well as at the consignee facility, the driver fail numerous times to conduct the required equipment inspections resulting in product spilling from where the washout cap was required to be secured. Environmental remediation was initiated immediately with a hazardous material cleanup contractor, Clean Harbors. Clean Harbors representative was identified as Bob Davis who reported to the scene and kept all parties involved informed of the remediation efforts. An internal root cause investigation also began immediately. The results of the investigation were communicated to all relevant parties, as well as the remediation progress right up until time of completion.

item.title: Report X-2023020195
item.description:
Report X-2023020195

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-26
  • City: WATERLOO
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Chicago Central and Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 26, 2023 at approximately 04:00 AM CDT a CN mechanical employee observed liquid dripping from the bottom outlet valve cap of rail car # GBRX 703550 (Load / UN 1987 / Class 3 / PG II / Alcohols N.O.S.) while performing an inbound train inspection at the CN Waterloo Yard in Waterloo, Iowa. The railcar was isolated, all required notifications made. CN Response Team responded to the location from Gary, Indiana. The cause of release is determined to be due to debris or an object trapped in the bottom outlet valve preventing a complete seal of the valve seat allowing product to fill and leak out of the improperly secured bottom outlet valve securement cap (BOV cap was not fully tightened. The BOV cap was tightened approximately 1/2 turn which stopped the leak. The BOV handle was then cycled to the open and closed position 5 times to free any possible obstruction from the valve seat. The BOV cap was completely removed and observed for any additional leakage for 10 minutes. There was no further indication of leakage and the BOV cap was re-applied utilizing a 36" pipe wrench. The exterior of the railcar was decontaminated, then released onto destination.

  • Description: On December 6, 2022 at 0833 ET, XPO Logistics (XDM terminal) contacted ERTS regarding a UN1759, Corrosive Solid, N.O.S., 8 PG II release that was discovered at 0825 ET. It was advised that at least 1 pound of product was released from several damaged bags in a trailer due to a forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup and containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-pounds of product released to the trailer floor in a 10' x 6' area due to a forklift puncture. The damaged bags, released product, and cleanup debris were collected into two 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO Terminal XDM called in to report a 1-gallon spill of UN3264 Poni Acid (AFCO 5380) from a 55-gallon plastic drum caused by the previous terminal loading metal drums on top of this plastic drums causing them to be crushed and impacting their trailer floor. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 4' x 4' area of the trailer floor due to leaking bung caps. The product was transferred from the damaged drum into a new 55 gallon poly closed top. The damaged drum was then placed into a 95 gallon poly drum. Absorbents were worked into the impacted areas and collected along with all cleanup debris into a 55 gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: XPO Terminal XCF contacted ERTS to report a one-cup spill of regulated UN2796 "Sulfuric Acid 50%" (sulfuric acid, with not more than 51% acid) that was released inside trailer #4635376 due to the drums not being properly sealed. ERTS dispatched contractors to assess. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-quart of product released to a 2' x 2' area of the trailer floor. The contractor advised that two drums of product got pressured up and the caps have resealing pressure relief devices which caused the product to leak out. Both caps had resealed themselves and were no longer leaking when crews arrived. The released area and drums were neutralized and the drums wiped down. The area in the trailer was cleaned with absorbents. All absorbent waste was containerized into a 55 gallon poly drum which was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

ERTS dispatched Clean Harbors to perform all onsite clean up operations. Clean Harbors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately (15)-gallons of product released affecting a 30’ x 10’ area of the trailer floor. Clean Harbors collected and containerized the damaged drum into (1) 95-gallons overpacked metal drum and all clean-up debris into (2) 55-gallons poly drums of waste, generated for disposal. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022090601
item.description:
Report E-2022090601

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:41+00:00

  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1750 ET, XPO Logistics reported a spill that occurred inside a trailer at the XPO terminal in XDM in Des Moines, IA. The spill consisted of a 330 gallon metal tote of UN1992 Corr12525b, which was damaged prior to arrival at the terminal due to improper loading which caused the tote to be slightly punctured by loose debris inside the trailer, causing a gallon to release. ERTS dispatched EnviroServe to conduct cleanup. At 1120 ET, EnviroServe arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 gallons of product released to a 3' x 2' area of the trailer floor. The product left in the damaged tote was pumped out into a 275 gallon poly tote and one 40 gallon closed top poly drum. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted area and collected. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (2) 55 gallon poly drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
